summary: Email chain between FBI Victim Specialists and attorney Gloria Allred's office regarding logistical arrangements for a DOJ briefing for Epstein victims. The discussion focuses on victim locations, COVID-19 concerns, and alternative meeting options like secure phone lines or Zoom.

persons.name: Mariann Wang
persons.context: Attorney at Allred, Maroko & Goldberg law firm, assisting Gloria Allred with representing Epstein victims. She provides a list of client locations to the FBI.

persons.name: Angela Jackson
persons.context: FBI employee in New York coordinating with victims' attorneys to arrange a DOJ briefing for Epstein victims, seeking information on client locations.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: High-profile attorney representing multiple Epstein victims. She communicates victim concerns about in-person meetings during COVID-19 and advocates for remote alternatives.

persons.name: Amanda N. Young
persons.context: FBI employee in New York copied on emails regarding the coordination of the DOJ briefing for Epstein victims.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Executive assistant to Gloria Allred who is initially contacted by the FBI to confirm receipt of briefing invitations for Allred's clients.

connections.description: Allred introduces Wang as her co-counsel assisting with the representation of Epstein victim clients.
Aldrich is identified as the Executive Assistant to Gloria Allred.
FBI Victim Specialist Jackson is in direct communication with attorney Allred to coordinate a DOJ briefing for her Epstein victim clients.
Both are FBI employees in New York working together on coordinating the victim briefing.

events.title: DOJ Briefing Coordination
events.description: Ongoing email coordination between the FBI and Gloria Allred's law firm regarding a planned DOJ briefing for Epstein victims. Discussions involve victim locations and alternative meeting formats due to COVID-19.

keyFacts: Attorney Gloria Allred represents multiple Epstein victims, including some not on the official DOJ list but who have previously spoken to prosecutors.
Allred's clients were not interested in flying to Miami for an in-person DOJ briefing, citing COVID-19 concerns.
Allred advocated for the DOJ to provide secure remote alternatives like a phone line or Zoom link for victims to receive information.
Victim locations provided by co-counsel Mariann Wang include international cities (Oslo, London, Moscow) and various U.S. locations.
The email chain reveals ongoing logistical challenges in communicating with victims spread across different countries and U.S. states during the pandemic.
